channel.title: Dave Winer's linkblog
channel.description: This has been in existence in one form or another for many years. Now it's being edited in FeedLand using a bookmarklet.

item.description: U.S. will run out of money on June 5.
item.source:markdown: U.S. will run out of money on June 5.

item.description: ChatGPT has an important new feature, now you can share links to conversations you had with the bot.
item.source:markdown: ChatGPT has an important new feature, now you can share links to conversations you had with the bot.

item.source:markdown: Bluesky rolls out feeds with custom algorithms.

item.description: Bluesky now lets you choose your own algorithm.
item.source:markdown: Bluesky now lets you choose your own algorithm.

item.description: Pretty sure I can say how default will play out. A run on every bank in the world at the same time when we all realize that the US govt can't guarantee our deposits. Will happen well before June 1.
item.source:markdown: Pretty sure I can say how default will play out. A run on every bank in the world at the same time when we all realize that the US govt can't guarantee our deposits. Will happen well before June 1.

item.description: YouTube is planning to support inbound RSS for podcasts, but apparently will not pass through the feed, in other words you'll have to use YT's user interface to listen to podcasts.
item.source:markdown: YouTube is planning to support inbound RSS for podcasts, but apparently will not pass through the feed, in other words you'll have to use YT's user interface to listen to podcasts.

item.description: The 500 Songs podcast episode on Ike & Tina Turner.
item.source:markdown: The 500 Songs podcast episode on Ike & Tina Turner.

item.description: Tina Turner, the earthshaking soul singer whose rasping vocals, sexual magnetism and explosive energy made her an unforgettable live performer and one of the most successful recording artists of all time, died on Wednesday at her home in Küsnacht, Switzerland, near Zurich. She was 83.
item.source:markdown: Tina Turner, the earthshaking soul singer whose rasping vocals, sexual magnetism and explosive energy made her an unforgettable live performer and one of the most successful recording artists of all time, died on Wednesday at her home in Küsnacht, Switzerland, near Zurich. She was 83.

item.description: Before Twitter blew up the devs, I used to from time to time put great art on the home page of my blog. Tech is like banks. When one fails, lots of other failures follow. It's inevitable when you depend on corporate APIs.
item.source:markdown: Before Twitter blew up the devs, I used to from time to time put great art on the home page of my blog. Tech is like banks. When one fails, lots of other failures follow. It's inevitable when you depend on corporate APIs.

item.description: Chief Justice Roberts in Supreme Court ethics pledge says he's "committed" to standards. #fascist
item.source:markdown: Chief Justice Roberts in Supreme Court ethics pledge says he's "committed" to standards. #fascist

item.description: Now that we have RSS feeds and OPML subscription lists for Bluesky, today I start developing applications that use that data. It's the first social network to have this feature.
item.source:markdown: Now that we have RSS feeds and OPML subscription lists for Bluesky, today I start developing applications that use that data. It's the first social network to have this feature.

item.description: I decided to pay Twitter a year in advance for the blue checkmark and whatever other privileges come with it. It's not that much money. I pay as much to Hulu or Apple TV. Is it worth it? I can afford to find out.
item.source:markdown: I decided to pay Twitter a year in advance for the blue checkmark and whatever other privileges come with it. It's not that much money. I pay as much to Hulu or Apple TV. Is it worth it? I can afford to find out.

item.description: Musk moves in on Murdoch.
item.source:markdown: Musk moves in on Murdoch.

item.description: By the same criteria you could say the New York Times is a far-right news organization. Whatever the story is about Twitter, it’s still developing. Journalism should be as rigorous in deciphering the intentions of journalism.
item.source:markdown: By the same criteria you could say the New York Times is a far-right news organization. Whatever the story is about Twitter, it’s still developing. Journalism should be as rigorous in deciphering the intentions of journalism.

item.description: ChatGPT is no better at explaining default than NPR. Default would not "erode" confidence in the US Treasury it would destroy it. Trust in the US as a safe place to store value would be over. It will never come back.
item.source:markdown: ChatGPT is no better at explaining default than NPR. Default would not "erode" confidence in the US Treasury it would _destroy_ it. Trust in the US as a safe place to store value would be over. It will never come back.

item.description: Wouldn't it be great if the news orgs instead of bullshitting us about the consequences of a default, actually explained it?
item.source:markdown: Wouldn't it be *great* if the news orgs instead of bullshitting us about the consequences of a default, actually explained it?
